<@U0PKMSYKG|j3ffyang> has joined the channel
<@U0Z3BE0F5>: sounds like you are seeing this issue <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/1204> …
it should really be benign if you are not using events…. ie, if you are having any other problem it’s likely not related to this error
its probably it because if I remove the CA everything works fine
I am trying to set up locally the marbles app and it probably uses events
but even if I don't use events, I cannot retrieve the information in the block where such chaincode is stored
(using the ...:5000/chain/blocks/1)
<@U0ULK2JPP>: is this related to the chaincode itself? Or it always happen if Privacy is enabled?

<@U0Z3BE0F5>: the error itself happens when the system attempts to remove the large deployment image before sending it out as an event - and fails because of encryption. The event is still sent but with the large deployment image
If your deployment fails I’d expect other errors before the sendProducerBlockEvent error
<@U0ULK2JPP>: but then checking the blockchain through the REST API is considered an event?
<@U0Z3BE0F5>: no, REST API do not go through the event framework.
I mean currently of course.
well, I am seeing this error when using the REST API too
ok. did the deploy itself work ?  I’m trying to understand the root issue
yes it did
the blocks are updated properly
but I cannot access the block where the deploy transaction is stored
ok
what REST API are you using ?
hyperledger?
I meant the specific REST API … I was not sure if going through marbles has a set of apis too
oh
I wasn't sure of you question
sure, np
well actually I tried it without marbles
just setting up a dev network
allow me to reproduce it and I'll explain the steps I have taken

<@U114Z77J6|alex.oberhauser> has joined the channel

Hi <!channel>. Has someone experience with the transition from Ethereum smart contracts to Hyperledger chaincode? As far as I have seen from the examples they share the underlying core concepts. Please correct me if I am wrong.
+1 great question, we are trying to achieve the reverse transition.
<@U114Z77J6>: you might be interested in Rootstock, which allows Ethereum contracts to be compiled directly into a Bitcoin-backed sidechain: <http://www.rootstock.io/>

The documentation for Solidity (Ethereum's contract language with similarities to JS syntax) is at <http://solidity.readthedocs.org/en/latest/introduction-to-smart-contracts.html#simple-smart-contract>

Solidity contracts run on the Ethereum Virtual Machine and so there is the first major difference. Still, a lot of the basic facilities of EVM have parallels in Hyperledger I imagine.

Looking at the examples in those docs, it is pretty easy to see how one would transcribe from Solidity to Go, but of course these do not make use of the advanced features of EVM.
Check <http://etherscripter.com|etherscripter.com> Maybe a enhancement to their tool will do the job.
<!here|@here> using docker-compose to manually launch 3 peers using the yaml files under bddtests, i don’t see port forwarding mappings, how do i figure out what ports to use to contact the peers?
the behave tests seems to suggest that using the yaml files with docker-compose i should be able to contact the peers with paths like http://<ip>:<port/network/peers
yes, i think so
but using “docker inspect” i don’t see port exposed
am i missing something?
<@U13TWBRBL>: the ports are NOT exposed, rather you can refer to the peers with there dockerCompose service name
from the behave tests themselves
<@U13TWBRBL>: what are you trying to perform that you cannot, and perhaps I can help you or modify the system if there is a deficiency
<@U13TWBRBL>: and you can refer to the docker-compose-default.yaml for the default port for all VPs
<@U13TWBRBL|jzhang> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/jzhang/F146Q4X1S/pasted_image_at_2016_04_27_11_05_am.png|Pasted image at 2016-04-27, 11:05 AM>
so this step suggests that i should be able to contact the peer via http right?

looking at compose-defaults.yaml:

vp:
  image: hyperledger-peer
  environment:
    - CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=true
    - CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=<http://172.17.0.1:4243>
    # TODO:  This is currently required due to BUG in variant logic based upon log level.
    - CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL=DEBUG
  command: peer peer
not sure what I should use as the port from the host to contact the peer
sorry, the setting is default per peer.address setting to 0.0.0.0:30303
that is the GRPC port
the HTTP port is 5000
aha 5000 works!
but where is that configured?
>/peer/core.yaml
sorry, I thought you meant at the vagrant level
or I should say, from docker container to vagrant
the other way around :simple_smile:
<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/peer/core.yaml#L26>

<@U0KLX3284>: Thank you for the link.

Where should I give some feedback on Hyperledger fabric ? Is this good channel ? For example, I invoke a chaincode to do some transaction, and then immediately query on worldstate gives me this error:

```Query chaincode result: {"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":{"code":-32003,"message":"Query failure","data":"Error when querying chaincode: Error:Failed to launch chaincode spec(Could not get deployment transaction for f94be74d5e8eaa1771642831198cf460486457ce96d765b552613040d4c095514c3dbb73c9d2c3fb743de570af8d463dcafb56683d3f32c4a49d597cea2676ad - ledger: resource not found)"},"id":5}```

Or do we have any list of error code ?  The purpose is to develop front end application such that it knows about the status of transaction, and UI can show like "Processing transaction, please try later ..." or something like this.
Note transactions are processed, and if I wait a while, I can query those result.
<@U11CP8FF1>: Lots of discussion at <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/588>

attachments.title: Transaction status tracking · Issue #588 · hyperledger/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: A proper mechanism for application to track the status of a transaction is missing today. I was asked about this by one of my colleague at IRL (who is building a demo). Initially, he planned to po...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: Transaction status tracking · Issue #588 · hyperledger/fabric

text: <@U0TFEHX8E>: Thanks. I have subscribed to the issue. In the meantime, I'll put wait or poll transaction. I think this is sufficient for the demo purpose.
